text: Carmino Ravosa (January 29, 1930 â€“ July 19, 2015) was an American composer and lyricist, singer, pianist, as well as a producer, director, and musical historian. Ravosa, who wrote music for children for decades. He was one of the most popular songwriters for schools in the country. Ravosa was an author and editor for Silver Burdett & Ginn's music textbook series "World of Music" and "The Music Connection", and the composer of the theme musicals in the two series. He also was a songwriter for the CBS children's shows Captain Kangaroo and Romper Room, the PBS program Shining Time Station, and the PBS publication Sesame Street Magazine. ==References== Category:1930 births Category:2015 deaths Category:American singer-songwriters Category:American pianists Category:American composers Category:American television producers Category:American television directors Category:American historians Category:Singers from Massachusetts Category:Writers from Massachusetts Category:Musicians from Massachusetts Category:Singers from New York (state) Category:Musicians from New York (state) Category:Writers from New York (state) Category:People from Springfield, Massachusetts
